Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Varicose \Var"i*cose`\ (?; 277), a. [L. varicosus, from varix, -icis, a dilated vein; cf. varus bent, stretched, crooked.] [1913 Webster] 1. Irregularly swollen or enlarged; affected with, or containing, varices, or varicosities; of or pertaining to varices, or varicosities; as, a varicose nerve fiber; a varicose vein; varicose ulcers. [1913 Webster]
2. (Med.) Intended for the treatment of varicose veins; -- said of elastic stockings, bandages. and the like. [1913 Webster]
varicose adj : abnormally swollen or knotty; "varicose veins"
